thread.title: The Dalles' Dakota Murr scores 53 points in 75-68 win over Hood River Valley
thread.title_full: The Dalles' Dakota Murr scores 53 points in 75-68 win over Hood River Valley

author: Billy Gates | (bgates@oregonian.com)
title: The Dalles' Dakota Murr scores 53 points in 75-68 win over Hood River Valley
text:
Girls news, photos 
There have been a handful of 50-plus scoring games in Oregon high school basketball this season, and The Dalles junior Dakota Murr decided it was time to put his name on the list. 
Murr scored 53 points on 17 of 30 shooting, including 6 of 10 from three-point range, and he shot 13 of 17 from the foul line in a 75-68 win Tuesday over Hood River Valley in Hood River. 
Murr completed a double-double with 15 rebounds and had 24 points at halftime. He poured in 17 points in the final frame to help the Riverhawks take two of three from the Eagles in Columbia River Conference play. The win puts The Dalles in a good position to claim the No. 3 seed and final play-in round spot with Hood River Valley's two remaining league games against top teams Pendleton and Hermiston. 
It was the final CRC game for The Dalles (5-15, 2-7 CRC), and Thursday they host Crook County. The Dalles ends the regular season on the road Friday against Ridgeview in Redmond. 
Murr joins Wilsonville's Zach Reichle and Parkrose's Isaac Bonton as Class 5A players to score more than 50 points in a game this season. Reichle scored 56 points against Milwaukie on Jan. 31, and Bonton netted 52 points Feb. 14. 
Overall, Murr is the fourth Oregon high school player to score more than 50 points in a game this season. Jefferson's Geno West scored 53 points on Feb. 14 -- the same night Bonton did his work. Here's how those games rank in Oregon since 2000 .
